question.text: Which cell organelle is called powerhouse?
question.explanation: Mitochondria produce ATP, the energy currency of cell.

question.text: What is the function of ribosomes?
question.explanation: Ribosomes are sites of protein synthesis in the cell.
Bacteria are prokaryotes lacking true nucleus and membrane-bound organelles.

question.option: Shrinking of cytoplasm from cell wall
question.explanation: Plasmolysis occurs when plant cell loses water in hypertonic solution.
Nucleus contains genetic material and controls all cell activities.

question.text: Which is present only in plant cells?
question.explanation: Cell wall made of cellulose is present only in plant cells, not animal cells.

question.option: Movement of water through semipermeable membrane
question.explanation: Osmosis is passive diffusion of water from high to low concentration.
Chlorophyll pigment is found in chloroplasts of plant cells.

question.text: Which gives shape to plant cell?
question.explanation: Rigid cell wall made of cellulose gives shape and support to plant cells.
